page.title: 04 BEAUCHIEF ABBEY
page.content:
Legend has it that{Robert Fitzranulph founded the abbey on his fairest land to try to compensate for his part in the murder of{Thomas a Beckett. {Fitzranulph}was Lord of Alfreton and Norton and had inherited vast estates given to his family by William the Conqueror.
The Abbey was built in the grand French style in{1176}and covered an acre with{250 acres}of land providing all fresh foods necessary. The Abbey estates stretched as far afield as Chesterfield,Norton and the Sheffield boundary some miles away.
In{1536}the Abott,{John Sheffield} surrendered the Abbey,its properties and lands to{Henry VIII.}Henry's Commissioner,{Thomas Cromwell}gave Beauchief to{Sir Nicholas Strelley
